intro: Forcipella repanda, commonly known as the broadleaf hollyhock, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the eastern United States and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant has palmate leaves with a velvety texture and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Forcipella repanda is a perennial herb that can grow up to 3 meters in height, making it a striking addition to gardens and natural habitats.
